hero_body_1: Comprehensive SBOM, HBOM & Vulnerability Management for Connected Device Security and Compliance.
hero_body_2: Designed to help device manufacturers identify, triage, mitigate, and report vulnerabilities with compliance support for major industry standards.
hero_card_body: Align vulnerability management with post-market surveillance, SBOM reporting, and global compliance programs.
auto_body: The automotive sector faces strict cybersecurity requirements for connected and autonomous vehicles. ARIANNA enables manufacturers and tier suppliers to build complete SBOMs/HBOMs, continuously monitor vulnerabilities, and manage them according to defined policies throughout the product lifecycle.
auto_use_1: Automates generation and maintenance of SBOM/HBOM for vehicle software and hardware.
auto_use_2: Supports vulnerability prioritization using exploit intelligence and industry risk profiles.
auto_use_3: Generates machine-readable reports (SPDX, CycloneDX, VEX) for regulatory submissions and audits.
auto_std_2: UNECE WP.29 / R155 & R156 – Cybersecurity and Software Updates Regulations
industrial_body: Industrial automation systems such as PLCs, SCADA, and control networks require robust vulnerability management and compliance with operational technology cybersecurity standards. ARIANNA’s platform helps by providing precise component inventories and continual risk assessment.
industrial_use_1: Creates accurate SBOM/HBOMs for embedded control systems and field devices.
industrial_use_2: Monitors and tracks vulnerabilities with exploitability data for industrial impacts.
industrial_use_3: Facilitates evidence generation for audit and compliance workflow automation.
industrial_std_1: IEC 62443 Series – Industrial Automation and Control Systems Security
medical_body: Medical device manufacturers must ensure device security and comply with regional medical regulations where cybersecurity evidence (such as SBOMs) plays a critical role in submissions. ARIANNA supports the inventory, vulnerability management, and reporting that regulators expect.
medical_use_1: Produces detailed SBOM/HBOMs aligned with build processes to minimize false positives.
medical_use_2: Prioritizes vulnerabilities based on clinical risk and exploit evidence.
medical_use_3: Supports integration with threat modeling, penetration testing, and risk assessments.
medical_std_1: FDA Pre-Market Submissions (510(k), PMA) – Cybersecurity Documentation
medical_std_2: EU MDR – Medical Device Regulation with cybersecurity expectations
medical_std_3: IEC TR 60601-4-5 – Security Requirements for Medical Electrical Equipment
iot_body: Connected consumer devices must adhere to best practices and emerging consumer cybersecurity guidelines. ARIANNA can generate and maintain component inventories and provide compliance artifacts for regulators and partners alike.
iot_use_1: Builds continuous SBOM and HBOM tracking for smart home devices and wearables.
iot_use_2: Highlights actively exploited vulnerabilities and supports remediation planning.
iot_use_3: Exports compliance reports for internal quality assurance and external audits.
iot_std_1: ETSI EN 303 645 – Consumer IoT Security Baseline Requirements
iot_std_3: CRA (Cyber Resilience Act) – EU Cybersecurity Regulation for Hardware/Software Products
cross_body: Across all industries, ARIANNA accelerates compliance preparedness and demonstrates sound cybersecurity practices by combining automated SBOM/HBOM generation with continuous vulnerability management.
cross_cap_1: Export SBOMs in SPDX, CycloneDX and CSV formats ready for regulatory submission.
cross_cap_2: Produce VEX reports for transparent vulnerability status reporting.
cross_cap_3: Manage policies tied to internal requirements or external standards.
cta_body: Book a tailored demo to explore vulnerability management workflows for your industry.
